$! You may need to tell DVLA if you've had retinal treatment. $!

% You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical treatment or condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted. %
  
## Car or motorcycle licence

###If you've had retinal treatment in one eye

You don't need to tell DVLA. 

###If you've had retinal treatment in both eyes

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form V1 and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D [Download ‘V1 - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 253KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_065620.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"} $D

## Bus, coach or lorry driving licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form V1V and send it to the address on the form.

$D [Download ‘V1V - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 261KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_065275.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"} $D

*[DVLA]: Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency
overview: You may need to tell DVLA if you've had retinal treatment - download the correct form if you need to let them know
title: Retinal treatment and driving
